meanings.definition: The quality or state of being rough.
meanings.sent1: The roughness of the sandpaper made it difficult to use.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the roughness of the tree bark against my palm.
meanings.sent3: The roughness of the cat's tongue surprised me during its grooming.
meanings.sent4: The roughness of the ocean waves echoed the turmoil in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The roughness of the road left my hands sore from the vibrations.

meanings.definition: A rough or uneven surface or texture.
meanings.sent1: She avoided sitting on the roughness of the wooden bench.
meanings.sent2: The roughness of the rock made it challenging to climb.
meanings.sent3: The roughness of the blanket felt cozy against my skin.
meanings.sent4: The roughness of the paper scratched my skin as I wrote on it.
meanings.sent5: The roughness of the carpet rubbed against my feet uncomfortably.

meanings.definition: The quality of being harsh or unpleasant in manner or sound.
meanings.sent1: His roughness in speech often offended others.
meanings.sent2: The roughness of her tone made me hesitant to ask for help.
meanings.sent3: Despite his roughness, he had a kind heart underneath.
meanings.sent4: The roughness of the music grated on my ears.
meanings.sent5: The roughness of her criticism left me feeling dejected.
